statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: California Riverside 75, Hope International 55
article.story: RIVERSIDE, Calif. (AP) -- Junior guard Larry Cunningham and senior guard Justin Bell each scored a game-high 14 points to lead UC Riverside to a 75-55 victory over Hope International on Saturday. Five Highlanders players scored in double figures, as UC Riverside (3-2) led by as many as 30 in its second straight victory over an NAIA opponent. Sophomore guard Chris Johnson and senior guard Dedrick Bates each added 13 points, and freshman center Sean Anderson scored 10. Cunningham added a game-high 12 rebounds and four assists for the Highlanders. Senior guard Bryan Fincham scored a team-high 13 points, and sophomore center Marko Torovic added 11 for Hope International (1-6), which lost its fourth straight. The Highlanders used an 18-2 run to take a 16-point lead nine minutes into the game, and UC Riverside pushed its advantage to 47-17 at halftime. The Highlanders, which beat NAIA Vanguard University by 25 on Wednesday, never extended their lead to more than 30 in the second half. But they never led by fewer than 20 after intermission, despite being outscored 38-28 in the second half. "We did pretty well in the first half, but we need to put two halves together," Cunningham said.
